title: Idaho Medicaid Provider List with NPI, Idaho State Licensed Healthcare Practitioner List with NPI

communications.subject: Idaho Public Records Act Request: Idaho Medicaid Provider List with NPI, Idaho State Licensed Healthcare Practitioner List with NPI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Idaho Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that include an updated list of all Idaho State Medicaid healthcare providers and ALL Idaho state licensed healthcare providers via an electronic data set (either CSV, excel, or PDF electronic format) to include all Dentists, and Dental Assistants. All types of licensed healthcare practitioners (Dentists, and Dental Assistants. Regardless of general or specialization.) from all dates electronically available would be appreciated. Specific items to be included in the data set: 
1. Provider name
2. National Provider Identification (NPI) number
3. Idaho State Healthcare License number and initial date of issuance or expiry (if available/applicable)
4. Education / School/Training, if available
5. Provider type (DDS, DMD, etc.)
6. Specialty
7. Practice Location
 
If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me of such instances.  However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s healthcare transparency, fairness, and public awareness.
If you expect a significant delay in responding to and fulfilling this request, please contact me by phone or via email with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you for considering my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Kalayanaprapruit

Your request is being processed in accordance with the Nevada Public Records Act (NPRA), Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) Chapter 239, and the Nevada System of Higher Education (NSHE) Board of Regents Handbook and Policies. Pursuant to NRS 239.0107(1)(c) within five (5) business days from the day after receiving this request for public record, the UNLV Office of Public Affairs will provide records or notify the requester of of the following: one 
 
  * Provide readily available record(s) to the requester for inspection or copying 
  * Give notice that the University is not the custodian of the record(s) and, if known, refer the requester to the appropriate state agency to request the record(s) 
  * Give notice that the record(s) will not be available within the five-day period and provide an estimated date when the record will be available for release. 
  * Provide notice that the request for release is denied, in part or in whole, and state the legal basis for its decision. If we release records, you can download them for a limited period of 60 days. 
 PLEASE NOTE: Nevada Administrative Code (NAC 239.867) provides no requirement for state agencies to create a public record that does not exist. Requests for information, legal research, or answers to general questions are not subject to the Nevada Public Records Act and will be handled accordingly. 
 Regularly monitor the progress of your request in My Request Center 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Office of Public Affairs 
University of Nevada, Las Vegas

All emails and other records released in response to FOIL requests 2016-002-00410 or 2017-002-00582. 

Note that the openrecords.nyc.gov website states that documents responsive to these requests "have been posted on the OpenRecords portal." However, no files are publicly available. A description of the records can be found on the following webpages:
https://www.politico.com/states/new-york/albany/story/2018/02/01/powerful-union-drafted-edited-fast-food-worker-bills-228603
https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2016-002-00410

title: MSHP Incident Info 3/1/24

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: MSHP Incident Info 3/1/24
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records that show all initial and follow up incident reporting information pertaining to the incident that took place on Friday morning, March 1, 2024 on and near highway 270 northbound lanes, just before the highway 70 interchange between the hours of 8am and 10am.

Copies of all records that show additional vehicle incidents that occurred on highway 270 between the interchanges of highways 44 and highway 70 that took place during the same hours. Please include documents that show details of vehicles make and model, that identify all local, state and federal law enforcement and safety agencies that collaborated in response to the incidents and that indicate whether there were any injuries or fatalities.

I am also requesting all traffic and safety camera footage from the same section of highway along 270 between the interchanges of highway 44 and West Florissant Ave for the same timeframe of 8am to 10am

I request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use.

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. If fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically or by CD-ROM if necessary.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P048067-031824
communications.communication:
Dear Kevin Hawkins: 
Our office received your open records request pursuant to Missouri's Sunshine Law, Chapter 610, RSMo. Your request has been assigned number P048067-031824. The Patrol is committed to adhering to the Sunshine Law and to ensuring that the public obtains access to open records that are not otherwise closed by law. The Sunshine Law requires each public agency to adhere to certain standards. This letter is designed to ensure that you understand our process for fulfilling your records request. Three Business Day Notice Requirement: 
The requested records are not immediately available for dissemination or inspection. The Patrol is required to notify you that additional research time will be required to fulfill the request. This correspondence satisfies the Sunshine Law's notice requirement within the required three business day period. Section 610.023.3, RSMo. 
 Additional Research Time is Required: 
The Patrol receives thousands of open records requests each month. Our Patrol Records Division personnel are dedicated to meeting the intent of Missouri's Sunshine Law and strive to respond to each request in a timely manner. The Patrol operates in all 114 Missouri counties and the independent city of St. Louis. Accordingly, many records maintained by the agency are not centrally located within, or immediately accessible to, the Patrol's Custodian of Records in Jefferson City. Our staff must research your request and ensure that we have captured all responsive records  ̶  regardless of their location within the agency. The research process is time-consuming, but we will make every effort to expedite your request. Estimated Time for Completion: 
The majority of our requests are fulfilled within thirty business days. Some requests require additional research time due to their scope or complexity. Our team will conduct an initial review of your request. If we estimate that the request will be fulfilled within thirty business days, we will not send an updated time estimate. However, if we estimate that the request will take longer than thirty business days, we will provide an updated time estimate that provides a detailed justification for the additional research time. Billing: 
As it relates to billing, Missouri law allows the Patrol to charge fees for copies and research time. Specifically, "[r]esearch time required for fulfilling records requests may be charged at the actual cost of research time." Section 610.026, RSMo. The Missouri Supreme Court recently determined that "staff time is the time required to provide access to public records maintained on computer facilities, recording tapes or disks, videotapes or films, pictures, maps, slides, graphics, illustrations or similar audio or visual items". Gross v. Parson, 624 S.W.3d 877, 884-89 (Mo. 2021) (internal quotations omitted). 
The Patrol will never bill you for redaction time or any research time conducted by our legal staff. You will only be charged for copies and staff research time as permitted by Missouri law. Please let us know if you have questions related to the billing estimate. 
Our team will forward a bill estimate to your attention once we have calculated the permissible costs and fees. The Patrol will not provide the responsive records until receipt of payment. Section 610.026.2, RSMo. 
We appreciate your patience as we review, research, and fulfill your open records request. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. If you wish to withdraw or clarify your request, or if you have questions, please call our office at (573) 526-6146, or (573) 526-6167. 
 
Sincerely, 
Gerard G. Callahan 
Custodian of Records 
 
Login Link: https://mshp.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/Login.aspx

Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. title: CPS: Restriction Letters, Options

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Restriction Letters, Options
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show copies of Parent Restriction letters issued from July 1, 2022 - June 30, 2023 for the following schools/instances:

1. Any letters issued by schools in the Options Network:

Jefferson High School
York High School
Simpson High School


These may also be listed as "Violation of Visitor Protocol" letters. Please note that I am not seeking any personally identifiable information or otherwise exempt information. As required by the statute, please ensure that the requested documents are redacted rather than exempting the entirety of the document. Additionally, for any and all exemptions used to redact exempt information, please provide clear and convincing evidence for each exemption used by your agency.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

I write to acknowledge receipt of the FOIL request that you submitted to the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority ("NYSERDA").  Your request seeks the information outlined below.

Your request has been referred to the appropriate NYSERDA program areas to search for the records that are responsive to your request. title: Medical Marijuana - Washoe County

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Medical Marijuana - Washoe County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Aggregated, monthly summary of new and renewed medical marijuana card applications since the inception of the program through January 1, 2023.

2) Any available data on the ages of medical marijuana patients (i.e. the number of patients that are 18, the number of patients that are 19, the number of patients that are 20, etc.) as of January 1, 2023.

3) Any records on the process of obtaining medical marijuana in any way or form and reported effects of medical marijuana on patients. 

I would like to receive these records in electronic format—if at all possible. To avoid problems with data compatibility, please provide all electronic information in a comma-delimited or ASCII text file, a format that can be easily opened by any spreadsheet or database program.

I can also accept ASCII text, dbase IV, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access and many other formats (just let me know and I'll see if we can use it). I can accept this data on CD-ROM, via email or FTP.

In addition, please provide copies of the record layout, code sheet and all relevant documentation regarding these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lindsay Burback

title: Jill Biden Visit

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jill Biden Visit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that Jill Biden visited Puerto Rico on Sunday, March 17, 2024: https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/locales/notas/llega-a-puerto-rico-jill-biden-primera-dama-de-estados-unidos/

Therefore I request the following records:

1) Any communications, messages, emails, and attachments between your department concerning Jill Biden's visit to Puerto Rico on March 17, 2024.

2) Any communications, messages, emails, and attachments between your department and Puerto Rican government agencies (including but not limited to: Puerto Rico Police Department, Office of the Governor (La Fortaleza), and the Municipality of San Juan) concerning Jill Biden's visit to Puerto Rico on March 17, 2024. These include A) any notes taken during the process of planning of the trip and B) any notes taken during the trip,.

3) Any presentations, presentation attachments, and instructional materials (these include but are not limited to audio, video, PowerPoint presentations, and slide formats) concerning Jill Biden's visit to Puerto Rico.

4) Any maps used in the planning of and during Jill Biden's visit to Puerto Rico.

This request is for all records produced between February 1, 2024 and the time this request is processed.

This request is not being used for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist and documents obtained by this request will be used in the course of reporting of FLOTUS visits to Puerto Rico. https://muckrack.com/carlos-e-berrios-polanco

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

title: USACE Community Meeting Madre Vieja Channel

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USACE Community Meeting Madre Vieja Channel
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that USACE convened a meeting with Aguada residents on May 11, 2023 about their concerns with levee placements along the Madre Vieja channel: https://periodismoinvestigativo.com/2023/07/residents-of-aguada-and-rio-piedras-require-green-alternatives-from-us-corps-of-engineers-to-channel-rivers/

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any digital communications, messages, emails, and attachments between your department about the aforementioned meeting with Aguada residents to discuss concerns about the levee. 

2) Any digital communications, messages, emails, and attachments between your department and persons who participated and/or helped facilitate the May 11 meeting with Aguada residents.

3) Any instructional materials, presentations, and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slide formats) used to prepare for or used during the May 11 meeting with Aguada residents. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discussed preparation for the meeting, B) notes taken during the meeting, C) any explanations (whether internally or externally generated) about the May 11 meeting, and D) any other document that has been used to help explain the proposed USACE dams along the Madre Vieja Channel (also known as the "Caño Madre Vieja").

This request is being made for all records produced between January 1, 2023 and the time this request is processed.

In the event that there are multiple responsive records, please send them to me on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist and these records will be used in the course of reporting about USACE construction projects in Puerto Rico. https://muckrack.com/carlos-e-berrios-polanco

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

title: FBI: Guenter Mannhalt

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Guenter Mannhalt
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Bureau records mentioning or pertaining to the deceased Seattle-area organized crime figure Guenter Mannhalt. Mannhalt (Born: February 25th, 1937 - Died: April 1st, 2019) was described by The Seattle Times in 1990 as being, "the kingpin of a crime ring operating out of a downtown doughnut shop." Another article by a respected Seattle historian described Mannhalt as a notorious exploiter of homeless teenagers in Seattle. Mannhalt was publicly identified by the Justice Department in the assassination of Civil Rights figure Edwin Pratt. 

In June of 2022, the Civil Rights Division of the Department of Justice publicly identified Mannhalt as a suspect in the 1969 assassination of Edwin Pratt, the director of the Seattle Urban League. The Justice Department publicly closed the Pratt file:

https://www.justice.gov/crt/case-document/edwin-pratt-notice-close-file

Internet searches bring back dozens of articles related to Mannhalt and crime. 

Including in the Seattle Times:

https://archive.seattletimes.com/archive/?date=19900509&slug=1070768

And in a local history blog:

https://crosscut.com/2014/03/seattle-donut-shop-runaways-part-two-knute-berger


This request is for any and all records about Guenter Mannhalt from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Mannhalt held by the Seattle Field Office. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Guenter Mannhalt.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Guenter Mannhalt.

Please include a search of any records or documents understood to be, or colloquially referred to as "COINTELPRO records" under the bureau's custody that could be construed as responsive to a request for records related to Guenter Mannhalt. 

If the bureau cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or if certain portions must be redacted, please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Records related to Mannhalt have a tangible and real connection to history, and their release will help provide the public with additional historical understanding. I would like to thank the bureau for it's commitment to transparency, especially in regards to investigations into Civil Rights era violence. I look forward to pressing forward with this request for however long it takes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware
